flow.title: Workflow
flow.intro: In general, here is the development workflow we will use:

data.title: Getting brief from client
data.description: Clients share project details and requirements. Through discussions, a clear understanding of the project scope and goals is established.

data.title: Task Breakdown
data.description: The project is divided into clear tasks and features, each with defined goals and priorities according to client requirements.

data.title: Start Development
data.description: Development starts with Agile, which involves continuous feedback and adjustments through 1-4 week sprints.

data.title: Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
data.description: An MVP is created, focusing on essential features that represent the core functionality of the project and for early testing.

data.title: Development Phase 2
data.description: We are doing improvements based on client feedback and changing needs, keeping the development process flexible.

data.title: User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
data.description: The product is tested internally and by the client, to meet their expectations and ensure it's issue-free before launch.

data.title: Deployed to Production
data.description: Once the client approves the final version during UAT, the website goes live. It is deployed to the designated server, making it accessible to users.
